intro: Hedyotis lactea, commonly known as the white baneberry, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. Hedyotis lactea typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
